research.title: Problem-Driven Learning
research.subtitle: Five characteristics of good questions
research.authenticityDesc: Questions should come from real-world challenges, not artificially created for teaching
research.opennessDesc: Good questions have no single correct answer, allowing multiple exploration paths
research.challengeDesc: Difficulty should be within the zone of proximal development, not too easy or too hard
research.interdisciplinaryDesc: Real-world problems often require integrating knowledge from multiple disciplines
research.meaningDesc: Questions should let students feel the value and see the potential impact of solving them
